name: Thistle Westminster

reviews.text: If the hotel looks awful on the outside, it is just the same, or worse, on the inside. It is urgently in need of a complete renovation. My room was extremely basic and decorated in a dredful 70`s style. It was impossible to look out of the window due to the ingrained dirt and grunge, and consequently very little light was let into the room. It seems as though the windows have never been cleaned. I was kept awake all night by noisey work going on on a next door building site, and was quite honestly glad to get out of the place earlier than I planned. Do not stay here!!!
reviews.title: Awful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival to the hotel we were told we had been given a free upgrade, for whatever reason we were thankful as we had been upgraded to a junior suite for the cost of a standard double room. This is after they had already reduced the room rate over the telephone. The hotel is very clean and well presented, all staff that we had dealings with were very helpful. It is situated in a great location for all the normal London sights, theatres and only a very short walk from Victoria train and coach stations. All in all we had a great stay at this hotel and will definately be staying again when we visit London. Another tip if you would prefer to eat out, the Bag of Nails pub over the road does some great food at very good prices.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay *****

reviews.text: Hotel seemed nice but staff and processes couldn't handle a busy weekend. We booked 4 rooms and 2 were not available even though we had pre paid directly from the Thistle website. They attempted to charge our Dinner 3 times even though we had pre paid this also via the website. Nice enough hotel but definitely avoid times and seasons where its likely to be busy!!! Dinner service in the restaurant was also very very slow even though there were only 3 tables occupied!!!
reviews.title: Very Poor stay

reviews.text: The hotel and room were spotless and we were made very welcome, customer service is excellent. A fantastic location central to everything. However, the breakfast let our stay down. The full English had been sitting there for era few hours and was cold. The toaster burnt the toast and the over enthusiastic waitress cleared your table every time you left it to get more food! Not enough staff were on the ball. Shame really it cast a shadow over our stay. One guest had the right idea, she was found in the reception area with a macdonalds breakfast!!
reviews.title: Great stay, disappointing breakfast

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for one night. Reception staff were efficient friendily and helpful. We had two double rooms opposite each other on the first floor. These were comfortable, clean and quiet. Room facilities, e.g. bathroom, Tea/coffee making and iron/iron board were good. The only small issue was the room temperature which was a little too warm. There was a heating system with a cool setting but this was ineffective. We were visiting London for the weekend to see Wicked (Saturday) at the Victoria Apollo and experience the Sport Relief (Sunday) events along the Mall. The hotel is ideally situated for this Theatre, Victoria station, Buckingham palace and is only a 10/15 minutes walk from Trafalgar square. We did not use the hotel restaurant. There are many reasonsably priced restaurants and cafes nearby which we used for evening meal/Breakfast. I would recommend this hotel for a weekend break.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: A very nice hotel close to Victoria. Spacious lobby and cafe area for meetings.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good service close to Victoria
Beware
reviews.text: Nice rooms.
Nice restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Fabulous for the price

reviews.text: WiFi should be complimentary, though.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We just stayed at the hotel for one night and although the room was quite large we had no hot water and the room was very hot without a way to turn down the heat. We also purchased the wifi for £10 and the hotel staff said it would be for 24 hours only to find out that he neglected to tell us that it could run out if we left our computers logged in! The hotel staff at the front desk was very unhelpful.
reviews.title: Worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night in January 2012 as we were in London to catch a gig and just needed somewhere to sleep.
reviews.title: Ok for one night.... Just bring a pillow

reviews.text: Hotel was lovely and quiet however, as people have previously said... the air con is a little fiddly and the room was a little cold.
reviews.title: Don't be put off by the external appearance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all thouigh i have no complaints about the room, it was clean, plenty of towels, bathroom was spacious but was in need a lift (it was clean so these things can be ignored)
reviews.title: No where near 4 star quality!

reviews.text: The only niggle was the pillows.... awful, flat and very uncomfortable, so if you do decide to stay at this hotel, then i sugest you bring your own.
reviews.title: Prehistoric....

reviews.text: Great location.. very close to lots of restuarants and bars aswell as Victoria Station, so less than 5 minute walk to the Tube.
reviews.title: Good central London Location if you get a cheap deal...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, about 150mtrs from Victoria station and just down the road from Buckingham palace.
reviews.title: London Weekend Hotel

reviews.text: The price for two nights was about the average for a good city centre hotel. The staff were superb, everyone was friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Standard chain, good location

reviews.text: The exterior of this hotel is not great but rest assured that the interior is fine. The criteria we use is location, price and cleanliness, this hotel ticks all the boxes.
reviews.title: Very Good but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looks hideous from outside, but the inside isn't bad - and a great location (though there are some roadworks outside so daytime noise is evident). You have probably stayed in many corporate hotels that are exactly the same. Service is friendly, rooms clean.
reviews.title: The best location we have found in London, as we arrive at Victoria bus station.

reviews.text: I have stayed here many times but not so recently as the price is beyond what my company will cough up for a hotel in London. I managed to get a cracking deal (£64, yes, that's right £64) thought it must have been a mistake but no just a post Christmas deal. At that price a hotel in this location which isn't actively nasty is a bargain.
reviews.title: Good place, comfortable and nice...

description: Located a couple of minutes’ walk from Victoria Station with all the main underground links and a direct link to Gatwick Airport, Thistle Westminster is an ideal location for either business or leisure. We’re also a short stroll from Buckingham Palace, and a mere 15 minutes on foot to Westminster Abbey, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament.
